official-title.#text:
To provide that no Federal or State requirement to
		  increase energy efficient lighting in public buildings shall require a
		  hospital, school, day care center, mental health facility, or nursing home to
		  install or utilize such energy efficient lighting if the lighting contains
		  mercury.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by
			 the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within
			 the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the following new
			 section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Title III of the Energy Independence and
			 Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/t:III

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, and the amendments made by those sections, no Federal
				or State requirement to increase energy efficient lighting in public buildings
				shall require a hospital, school, day care center, mental health facility, or
				nursing home to install or utilize such energy efficient lighting if the
				lighting contains
				mercury.
